caption: b'We launched our #ManulifeActofKindness program on Tuesday and have been overwhelmed by the amazing response from our teams around the world. Watch how our teams have sprung into action with their acts of kindness. Visit Manulife.com/actofkindness for more stories.'

b"We've been recognized by Canada's Top 100 Employers as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2021. This award has become a benchmark in the Greater Toronto Area for exceptional human resource programs and forward-thinking workplace policies. We're committed to our employees every day and are proud to be recognized as a top employer."

b'2020 has been a difficult year for many individuals, families and communities around the world. This #GivingTuesday, our President & CEO Roy Gori (@thegoridetails) is proud to announce the #ManulifeActofKindness program. All 35,000 members of our global team will receive a contribution to pay it forward and create acts of kindness in their communities. Visit Manulife.com/actofkindness to learn how we are making lives better for our communities around the world.'

b'#TransgenderAwarenessWeek is a time to take action and amplify the transgender community through education, sharing experiences and stories, as well as an opportunity to bring light to the issues that transgender people face around prejudice, discrimination and violence. This year for the first time, we are raising the Trans Pride Flag at our North American offices.'

b"On #WorldDiabetesDay, we reflect on our history of support for people living with diabetes. In 1942, we became the first North American company to offer life insurance for those living with diabetes. And in November 2019, @JohnHancock launched John Hancock Aspire \xe2\x80\x94 the first and only life insurance designed for Americans living with diabetes. We're proud to continue to help those with this condition live longer, healthier lives."
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve released our Q3 results, check out some highlights from the quarter.'

b'Lest we forget. On #RemembranceDay let us remember those who have given their lives during Canadian wartime and peacekeeping missions. For every social media post that uses #ManulifeRemembers, a donation will be made to the Royal Canadian Legion in support of Veterans and their families. We also encourage you to purchase a digital poppy at mypoppy.ca to support the Legion.'

b'In tribute to those who have lost their lives to protect our country, we have planted over 12,000 flags on the lawn of our Toronto headquarters. For every social media post that uses #ManulifeRemembers, a donation will be made to the Royal Canadian Legion in support of Veterans and their families.'

b'"My grandfather served with the Royal Air Force during WWII, and spent years away from his family in Saskatchewan. My dad, seen here in this picture at the age of four, proudly wore a children\'s military uniform showing his support for those fighting overseas, and the pride he had in his father. I am so thankful that I have not known war in my lifetime nor the separation of loved ones during the time of war. I\'m also proud of the sacrifice that so many men and women have made." \xe2\x80\x93 Jason Jacobs, Director of Communications\n\nFor every social media post that uses #ManulifeRemembers, a donation will be made to the Royal Canadian Legion in support of Veterans and their families.'

b"Remembrance Day holds great significance to many of us, in different ways. Share your story with us on social media using #ManulifeRemembers to show us how, why or who you're remembering. For every social media post that uses #ManulifeRemembers, a donation will be made to the Royal Canadian Legion in support of Veterans and their families.\n \nPhoto: November 2019"

b"We've been named one of the World's Best Employers for 2020 by @forbes. The results are based on employees' willingness to recommend their own employers to friends and family, and participants were asked to rate their employers' COVID-19 responses, image, economic footprint, talent development, gender equality and social responsibility. We're proud to be a workplace where employees are happy bringing themselves to work every day."

b"We love being able to share stories about employees who are dedicated to driving positive change.
 
After George Floyd was killed in May, Roland Fletcher, from our Inside Sales and Retention team in Canada, wanted to do something to honour him \xe2\x80\x93 and to raise awareness around systemic inequalities and anti-black racism. So, Roland and his wife Sandra committed to cycling 46 kilometers a day for 46 days as part of the #46ForGeorge campaign \xe2\x80\x93 46 being the age George Floyd was when he died.
 
\xe2\x80\x9cSandra and I were inspired by local cyclist Matthew Cuesta, who started #46ForGeorge to create a platform for conversations about racial injustices in our society,\xe2\x80\x9d says Roland. \xe2\x80\x9cThe main theme of the campaign was 'get uncomfortable'.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
That\xe2\x80\x99s exactly what they did. Doing all that riding was definitely uncomfortable, but that was the intention: getting uncomfortable to inspire uncomfortable conversations.
 
As a company, we are invested in diversity, equity and inclusion. Thank you Roland for sharing your story with us."

b'Two years ago our employees helped us create and launch Manulife\xe2\x80\x99s new Values \xe2\x80\x93 six declarations that define our culture and how we show up for customers, colleagues and communities. Fast forward to today, and these values have never been more important in navigating the current environment as well as the opportunities and challenges that emerge from it. Happy second anniversary!'
b'Wishing Canadians a relaxing long weekend. What are you thankful for this year?'
b"It's #WorldMentalHealthDay. Remember to set aside time for your mental health today, and every day. If you don\xe2\x80\x99t know where to begin, taking a breath is a good start."
b'Sending greetings to all our employees and customers celebrating the Mid-Autumn Festival. We hope you spend today (safely) celebrating with your loved ones.'

b'With today being Orange Shirt Day in Canada, this year and for many years to come, we are honouring this observance as a company. Orange Shirt Day is an event designed to educate people and encourages meaningful and crucial conversations about the residential school system and the effect it has had on Indigenous children. Indigenous Peoples and Their Allies (IPTA), a new Employee Resource Group at Manulife, is leading a number of initiatives to help honour this day and as we reflect on the history, is providing education for a better tomorrow.'

b"On this #WorldHeartDay and every day, we're proud to share what we\xe2\x80\x99re doing for the heart health of our employees and customers. Through online programs like our #StayHealthy fitness series, products like Manulife Vitality and ManulifeMOVE, and sponsorships like Ride for Heart and the Boston Marathon, we're encouraging people to get up and get moving. \n \nIf you're waiting for a sign that you should do some physical activity today, this is it!"

b"It's time to talk money. Our friends over at @JohnHancock have launched the Friends Who Talk About Money podcast, which celebrates financial conversations in all their honest, awkward and inspirational glory. The first 9 episodes are already live, find them on your favourite streaming platform today."
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b'Though back to school looks a bit different this year, we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support 11 Canadian students in their pursuit of post-secondary education. Check out the recipients of this years Manulife Life Lessons Scholarship Program at manulife.ca/manulifelifelessons.'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b"In honour of Labour Day in Canada and the US, we're sharing this image that captures the ideal essence of the long weekend. This peaceful photograph dates back to 1921, and was taken at the Manufacturers Life Convention at Algonquin Park in Ontario, Canada."

b"95 years ago today, we opened the doors to our global headquarters in Toronto. Although we won't be able to celebrate this anniversary in the office today, we want to highlight this milestone and how far we've come since 1925."
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b"It\xe2\x80\x99s #NationalHoneyBeeDay. In 2017, we partnered with @alveolebuzz to install honeybee hives at many of our properties across North America. Since then we've expanded to 60 hives across in Montreal, Toronto, Ottawa, Calgary and Vancouver. At peak season, that\xe2\x80\x99s over 3,000,000 bees, with honey production at over 900 kilos. BEE-utiful!"

b'That\xe2\x80\x99s a wrap on Camp Manulife! While we are sad for it to end, we\xe2\x80\x99ve enjoyed seeing all our campers learn new skills, create unique projects and make memories. Today we closed out the program with a special End of Camp show, and in true camp fashion, we had one final singalong of the Camp song.\nThank you, campers, for making this summer fun!'

b'Employee recognition is important at Manulife - our annual Stars of Excellence program is one of the ways we celebrate and reward our top performers. Congratulations to our 2019 Stars of Excellence!'

b'This week Camp Manulife is bringing you a camp classic - Homemade Play Dough! Taught by Kristin Augusta, Director of Training & Development at John Hancock, and her family. Check out our full schedule of activities at manulife.com/en/about/camp-manulife'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b"Happy Book Lovers Day! This year we brought together our book-loving employees through the creation of the Manulife Book Club, which is one way we've managed to stay socially connected despite working from home. Last week we were lucky enough to welcome @franceschawrites, author of \xe2\x80\x9cIf I Had Your Face\xe2\x80\x9d, who joined our virtual meeting from Seoul, South Korea."
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve released our Q2 results, swipe to see some highlights from the quarter.'

b"We're bringing the spirit of summer camp right to you! For this Camp Manulife activity, Godfrey Jerry, AVP Life and Disability Operations will show you how to play with science to make your own lava lamp. Check out our full schedule of activities at manulife.com/en/about/camp-manulife"
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b"\xe2\x80\x9cManulife has taken an active role through COVID-19 on several critical fronts in supporting our customers, partners, and communities. That's why we're also proud to partner with CIFAR in their world-leading research. These projects will positively impact the global fight against this pandemic and this type of research will be essential to recovery efforts\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Karen Leggett, our Global Chief Marketing Officer on our funding of six new COVID-19 and population health research projects with CIFAR."

b'Welcome to Camp Manulife! Today we\'re creating "Marbled Paper" with Terri Hayes, AVP Enterprise Operations & IT at John Hancock. Check out our full schedule of activities at manulife.com/en/about/camp-manulife'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b'Today, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to officially kick off Camp Manulife \xe2\x80\x93 a 4-week virtual program designed to get our employees\xe2\x80\x99 children moving, learning and creating. Happy first day to our 2,500 campers!'
b'Happy 35th Anniversary, Manulife Indonesia!'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s (Virtual) Parade Day! We\xe2\x80\x99re a PROUD sponsor of @pridetoronto\xe2\x80\x99s virtual festival. Capping off Pride, the Virtual Parade will honour the community\xe2\x80\x99s past and progress and will be followed by a virtual dance party. As one of Canada\xe2\x80\x99s best diversity employers we have an ongoing commitment to inclusion, and that commitment will hold true through any situation. #ManulifePROUD #StayProudStaySafe'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWe recognize that driving change means taking action, which is why we are making these important investments in building greater diversity on our team, and a deeper awareness of the role we can all play in being an ally and supporter of inclusion\xe2\x80\x9d Our President and CEO Roy Gori (@thegoridetails) announces our plan to invest more than $3.5 million to promote diversity, equity and inclusion.'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b'Today\xe2\x80\x99s the day to show dad a little appreciation. Whether you\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating virtually or in person, or taking the day to fondly remember a good man who isn\xe2\x80\x99t with us anymore, we\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating with you. From all of us at Manulife, Happy Father\xe2\x80\x99s Day.'

b'Tomorrow is #InternationalDayofYoga, take 20-30 minutes to focus on your well-being with these 6 yoga stretches. Hold each pose for 20-30 seconds OR 4 deep breaths with extended exhales and repeat throughout the day when not being physically active to help with flexibility in the spine, decrease tension in neck and shoulders and promote mobility in the hips. Make the appropriate adjustments to fit your current fitness level. \nJoin us every Tuesday morning on Facebook for yoga with Kristy and Thursday morning for David\xe2\x80\x99s Garage Grind workout.'
b'Today is \xe2\x80\x9cThank You Day\xe2\x80\x9d for our entire global team. A day to rest and recharge to focus on health and well-being. From all of us at Manulife, have a great weekend!'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b'We continue to stand for equality for all and embrace the diversity of our colleagues, customers and communities. Although this year\xe2\x80\x99s Pride celebrations will look a little different, they\xe2\x80\x99ll continue to promote the spirit of togetherness, resiliency and support. This year, we\xe2\x80\x99ll be raising Pride flags with added black and brown stripes in recognition of and in solidarity with People of Colour. #ManulifePROUD'

b"We're thrilled to support the first-ever virtual Manulife Heart & Stroke Ride for Heart! Join us today for the Livestream event to celebrate with our community of survivors, participants and donors. Tune in at 12 pm EST on rideforheart.ca. #VirtualRideforHeart"
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIn gratitude for all you have done \xe2\x80\x93 and to help you see how great it feels to take a break \xe2\x80\x93 we are giving our entire global team a \xe2\x80\x9cThank You Day\xe2\x80\x9d off this year.\xe2\x80\x9d our CEO, Roy Gori (@thegoridetails) announced a day off for all staff this year in appreciation of everyone\xe2\x80\x99s hard work as well as awarded five personal days next year to support their well-being.'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'
b'Join our #StayHealthy fitness series on Facebook this Tuesday and Thursday at 7:30 am ET. Sign up for class reminders over on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/manulife'
b'This year, #MothersDay is looking a little different. But one thing won\xe2\x80\x99t change: there will still be lots of love.'
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve released our Q1 results, check out these highlights from the quarter.'
b'10,000 followers and counting. To our Instagram community, thank you for your support.'
b'To our #HealthcareHeroes, you are essential. We are grateful. Thank you from all of us at Manulife. #LightItBlue'

b"As we continue to serve our customers and support our communities through this challenging time, we remain committed to leading sustainability initiatives that make a meaningful, long-lasting difference.\n\nPart of that is our vision to cut carbon emissions and drive leadership in sustainable real estate. Here are some ways we've already made progress, and our goals for 2022."
b'The current state of the market can be stressful and hard to navigate. Here are some tips to help you deal with uncertainties.'
b'Tonight, we are lighting all our buildings in blue from coast to coast. Thank you to all #HealthcareHeroes. You are essential. We are grateful. #LightItBlue'

b"We are thrilled to support @glblctzn's One World: #TogetherAtHome concert. Join us as we take action with music & celebrate our #HealthcareHeroes in the global fight to crush the curve. For more details on how to watch & get involved visit @glblctzn #Manulife"

b'We are proudly partnering with @glblctzn for One World: #TogetherAtHome \xe2\x80\x94 a night of music and action on April 18 to celebrate the heroic efforts of community health workers and support the @WHO in the global fight to end COVID-19. Take action with us now.'
b'Thank you to all #HealthcareHeroes. You are essential. We are grateful.\nIn your honour, we have lit up our global headquarters in blue. #LightItBlue'

b'Today, we wear pink to celebrate our differences and stand up against all forms of bullying and discrimination. We know this is a difficult and uncertain time, which is why it\xe2\x80\x99s more important than ever that we stay connected, support each other and demonstrate kindness. Join us in celebrating International #DayOfPink in a new way \xe2\x80\x93 with virtual observances worldwide!'

b'We would like to thank our teams around the world for getting it done together and sharing their humanity during this pandemic. And for helping us make the health and safety of our colleagues, customers and communities our # 1 priority.'

b'During times like these, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to take care of yourself and stay active, while practicing social distancing. Exercise can help you cope with stress and sleep better. Here\xe2\x80\x99s a list of easy ways for you to exercise at home.'

b'We are focused on giving people safe access to food throughout the coronavirus pandemic. We are proud to announce our commitment to communities with several important measures including $1 million to support safe access to food for communities in need across Canada, $1 million to the Boston Resiliency Fund through @JohnHancockUSA and encouraging employees to support local charities through our employee match programs in Canada and in the US.'

b'We are well-positioned to navigate the evolving situation around COVID-19 and we are here for you. We will remain focused, committed and resilient. For more information, please visit www.manulife.com.'

b'The Manulife Vitality program helped push Kiran to stop making excuses when it came to her health and fitness goals. See how Canadian members like Kiran are living their best life with Manulife Vitality at Manulife.ca/vitality/reviews'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve been named one of Canada\xe2\x80\x99s Best Diversity Employers by @topemployers for the third year in a row! We want everyone to feel included, respected, and comfortable with bringing their whole selves to work. Encouraging an inclusive working environment where people feel valued, engaged and that they belong, are key to building a high performing team. \n#DiversityEmployers #TopEmployers2020'

b'Happy International Women\xe2\x80\x99s Day! We\xe2\x80\x99re working hard to be a place where women can grow their careers and thrive. \nJoin us in showing your commitment to gender equality by posting a photo of the #EachForEqual pose.\n#IWD2020'

b'In 1978, Dr. Gail Cook-Bennett was the first female director elected to the Board. In 2008, she became a Chair of the Board, making her the first woman named Chair of the Board of a major Canadian financial institution. #EachForEqual #IWD2020'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re working hard to be a place where women can grow their careers and thrive. Ahead of International Women\xe2\x80\x99s Day, we want to celebrate the success of women at Manulife.\nIn 1975, Cicely Hobson became a Certified General Accountant. She was the first woman at Manulife to earn that designation. #EachForEqual #IWD2020'

b'February is Black History Month in North America and our employee resource groups VIBE (Valuing the Inclusion of Black Experiences) and AMP (Association of Multicultural Professionals) have planned a number of events for our teams to connect, share their humanity, and learn from one another. "One of the reasons it\xe2\x80\x99s important for us to observe and honour Black History Month as an organization is because it speaks to how we value the diversity of our people. When we all celebrate milestones like Black History Month we are saying that there\xe2\x80\x99s no \xe2\x80\x98us and them,\xe2\x80\x99 just an opportunity for all of us to focus on what still needs to be done \xe2\x80\x93 to make every employee feel visible and valued every day.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Schazelle York, Senior Training & Development Consultant and VIBE co-chair.\n\n#BlackHistoryMonth'

b'Last week at Manulife we brought our entire global team together like never before with our first-ever Global Employee Forum hosted by our CEO, Roy Gori (@thegoridetails). This event represented something completely different for us and was a significant milestone in our transformation journey to become the most digital, customer-centric global company in our industry.'

b"In our first year as a founding partner of @heartandstroke\xe2\x80\x99s Women\xe2\x80\x99s Initiative, together we helped raise over $5 million. We're proud to continue our support through 2020! #HeartMonth"
b'Check out the solid results from our #WinningTeam in Q4 and throughout 2019. #DecisionsMadeEasier #LivesMadeBetter'

b'We were honored with a corporate award in Toronto this weekend at the Great Valentine Gala hosted by the Canadian Foundation for Physically Disabled Persons. Both Manulife and @ryerson_u were recognized for outstanding corporate leadership in the advancement of diversity, accessibility and inclusion in the workplace.'

b'Feeling supported by your company\xe2\x80\x94personally and professionally\xe2\x80\x94goes hand-in-hand with being part of a high-performing organization. \nAt Manulife, we believe that mental wellbeing is as important as physical wellbeing. We offer our employees in Canada and their dependents $10,000 per year towards mental health services to remove cost as a barrier to accessing help. \n#BellLetsTalk'
b'Happy Lunar New Year! May the year of the Rat bring you prosperity, good health and luck. :party_popper::rat::confetti_ball:'
b'Happy new year! :partying_face::party_popper::balloon:'
